summary: Shouldn't, the Prequel - Nevermore_red - A Song of Ice and Fire - George R. R. Martin [Archive of Our Own]
body:
I’m going back over some of my older works and editing them and giving them a little revamp. The longer I’ve been writing and publishing this stuff on the archive, the more I realize how very little editing I did. It’s a bit embarrassing to go back and see all the mistakes!

I’ve already edited my very first work, Should and Shouldn’t, and now I’ve finished editing the prequel of it for anyone who wants to go back and read it again, or maybe for the first time!


Shouldn’t, the Prequel - Nevermore_red - A Song of Ice and Fire - George R. R. Martin [Archive of Our Own]

blog.name: ao3feed-sansaery
blog.title: A Sansaery Ao3feed
blog.description: I want very much for you to be happy, Sansa

title: For the dreamers
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2Qm0b7b

by Queenofthebees

They couldn’t go back and change it all now though. If she were being honest with herself, she wasn’t sure she wanted to think about it anymore. Although Joffrey and Harry had undoubtedly been mistakes, she didn’t regret Margaery. At least that break up had been amicable (even if Sansa’s broken heart tried to insist she had been abandoned, her head knew better) and Margaery had loved her. It would have ended anyway, their different goals pulling them in different directions. Despite her heartache, Sansa admired Margaery and the fact she would always go for what made her happy. Sansa supposed she could learn something from that and perhaps the new year wouldn’t be so daunting after all if she could work up the courage to tell Jon she still loved him too.

Words: 1650, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

  • Categories: F/M
  • Characters: Jon Snow, Sansa Stark, Catelyn Tully Stark, Ned Stark
  • Relationships: Jon Snow/Sansa Stark, Sansa Stark/Margaery Tyrell (past)
  • Additional Tags: Alternate Universe - Modern Setting, Pining, Post-Break Up, Sansaery break up that is, skirting around feelings

summary:
I notice the whole red door has been brought up in a few metas I’ve read. 
What about the lemon trees that Dany dreams about?...
body:
I notice the whole red door has been brought up in a few metas I’ve read.

What about the lemon trees that Dany dreams about? Lots of people theorized that it means Viserys lied to Dany about where they grew up. But lemons are also connected to Sansa. Lemons symbolize purification, healing, love, happiness, optimism and used to fight negative energy. Sounds very much like a dream of spring.

The connection of lemons has to have a deeper meaning.

summary: Confessions of a Jonsa Shipper: Sansa Stark’s rape in season 5 is up there in one of the most traumatizing things I’ve ever seen...
body: Confessions of a Jonsa Shipper: Sansa Stark’s rape in season 5 is up there in one of the most traumatizing things I’ve ever seen on screen. As someone who gets triggered by seeing violence against women, I couldn’t even watch it fully. Though they don’t visually show the attack, the noises and the close up shot of Reek’s face was enough to wreak havoc on your emotions! The scene was just so brutal and gut wrenching and it’s not surprising that there was such an uproar about it. How many years later and I still can’t watch that scene without fast forwarding it.

The scene was just so brutal and gut wrenching and it’s not surprising that there was such an uproar about it. How many years later and I still can’t watch that scene without fast forwarding it.

I’ve now written a chaptered fic. Who is she?
